document.docAuthor: Ferreira, Luciane Augusto De Azevedo & Anker, Arthur
document.masterDocTitle: An annotated and illustrated checklist of the porcelain crabs of Panama (Decapoda: Anomura)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: An annotated and illustrated checklist of the porcelain crabs of Panama (Decapoda: Anomura)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Porcellana poeyi Guérin-Méneville, 1855
: xvi, pl. 2, fig. 4.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Not
Megalobrachium poeyi .
—
Haig 1960: 214
, pl. 16, fig. 4, pl. 39, fig. 1;
Haig 1968: 71
;
Gore 1971: 404
(part., Pacific specimens) [=
Megalobrachium pacificum Gore & Abele, 1974
].

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined .
Panama [Caribbean]: 1 female , cl 7.0, cw 7.4 ( MZUSP 33522 ), Bocas del Toro
,
Isla Colón , between STRI station and Playa Bluff , depth
0.3–1 m
, fossilised coral platform and adjacent flat with coral rubble and rocks, under large rocks and in coral rock crevices, leg. A. Anker et al .,
26.04.2015
; 1 ov. female, cl 6.9, cw 7.0 ( FLMNH UF 57122 ), Bocas del Toro ,
Bahía de Almirante
, 9°22’00.3”N , 82°17’08.0”W , depth less than
2 m
, under coral rock, leg. P.P.G. Pachelle ,
01.04.2019
(fcn PP 19-145)
.

Ecology . Lower intertidal and subtidal, more common in shallow protected bays, known depth range: 0–46 m ; in accumulations of fragmented corals and under or within coral rubble ( Gore & Abele 1976 ; Gore 1982 ; Werding 1984).

Remarks . The carapace of the Panamanian specimens of
M. poeyi
varies from beige or pale brown-orange with pinkish tinge to a more intense purple-pink, with the colour of the P1 also varying from whitish with pink or greyish tinge to pale pink-orange or purplish pink colour ( Figs. 12 , 13 ). Thus, they corroborate Werding’s (1977) observations of the colouration of
M. poeyi
based on the Colombian material and also align well with the colour photographs of this species published by
Rodríguez et al. (2005)
, Poupin & Lemaitre (2014) and Hiller & Lessios (2019), from Panama , Guadeloupe and Venezuela , respectively. Based on molecular data, Hiller & Lessios (2019) recovered two very recently separated clades within
M. poeyi
, one containing the eastern and south Caribbean specimens ( St. Martin , Colombia , Venezuela ) and the other with Florida and western Caribbean ( Costa Rica ) specimens. Comparing the colour photographs of specimens of
M. poeyi
from Panama ( Figs. 12 , 13 ;
Rodríguez et al. 2005
), Guadeloupe ( Poupin & Lemaitre 2014 ), Saint Martin (A. Anker, pers. obs.) and Venezuela (Hiller & Lessios 2019), it seems that the specimens from the western Caribbean ( Panama ) are usually more intensely pink-red coloured than the paler white-orange or white-pinkish specimens from Saint Martin , Guadeloupe and Venezuela .
